mxTextCell.title: Text
mxTextCell.label:
Then we need to augment the
difficulty threshold when the
player wins

mxTextCell.title: Text
mxTextCell.label:
We can no pick for any battle if it is a win or lose
But 50/50 is not a reality, so we have to put 
dynamic values in there.

mxTextCell.title: Text
mxTextCell.label: Let's start with a simple battle generator, which will determine how many battle the player does.

mxTextCell.title: Text
mxTextCell.label:
This pool will be used to determine if
the battle results in a win or lose without
spending resources from the Battles counter

mxTextCell.title: Text
mxTextCell.label:
The first thing we will need
is to give XP to the player
depending on win or Lose

mxTextCell.title: Text
mxTextCell.label:
A simple LVL up
You can make one via a register
to use your XP formula

mxTextCell.title: Text
mxTextCell.label:
Some modifications on the start here. The generator start with one fight
Then waits for it to be sorted to create another battle, thanks to the trigger from the gate
In order for it to work, I switched the automatic activation from the gate to the pool before the gate

mxTextCell.title: Text
mxTextCell.label:
Here, I've made a system to check the ratio LVL/Dif
and then multiplied it by 100 in order to get a % expression
I can send on the gate, to modify the Win/Lose chances
